meanings.definition: Bring (goods or services) into a country from abroad for sale.
meanings.sent1: The company decided to reimport the popular toys from overseas to sell in local stores.
meanings.sent2: It is common for businesses to reimport products to meet the demands of customers.
meanings.sent3: The store owner had to reimport the rare items to keep up with the high demand.
meanings.sent4: She had to reimport the unique fabrics to showcase her new collection.
meanings.sent5: The decision to reimport the vintage cars made the car enthusiasts excited.

meanings.definition: Bring (goods or services) back into a country after they have been exported.
meanings.sent1: After the trade show, they had to reimport the unsold items back into the country.
meanings.sent2: The company had to reimport the defective products for inspection and repair.
meanings.sent3: The chef had to reimport the exotic spices to recreate the authentic dish.
meanings.sent4: She had to reimport the old machinery to continue production in the factory.
meanings.sent5: The decision to reimport the outdated technology was necessary for the project.
